Coverage remained the same at 69.513% when pulling **b6848d54c4eac2942abed6ce363aaa5ae3f2ba05 on tc-dc:bigtable-done-notification** into **014614b695bac0b636aae662977dd3a3fa3b8a1e on apache:master**.

The user agent is meant to be set automatically from PipelineOptions here:
https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/gcp/bigtable/BigtableIO.java#L594
It seems as though two methods are called getBigtableService and only one has the userAgent propagated forward.
The method `pipelineOptions.getUserAgent()` is not marked `@Nullable` and the default looks to always be non-null. Wouldn't the pipeline options code for `setUserAgent` fail if it were set to null?

LGTM. Thanks.

Merging.
It would fail but it is up to each runner to set the user agent beyond the default.
looks good for self-merge.
Updated BigTableIO.Read.getBigTableService() instead of IT. Luke, PTAL.

run java precommit

Wait, sorry, I just looked at this again. A `Reader` should only be interacted with by a single thread except in very specific circumstances. `advance`, `getCurrent()`, `getWatermark`, and `getCurrentTimestamp` must all be interacted with in a thread-safe manner (usually this means a single thread). The reader should not have to perform any synchronization within them. Specifically, the `UnboundedReader` javadoc states: ``` /** * A {@code Reader} that reads an unbounded amount of input. * *

A given {@code UnboundedReader} object will only be accessed by a single thread at once. */ ``` The synchronization is as such unnecessary
However, please fix the checkstyle failures before submission
BTW the change from `repackaged` to `private` is deliberate, reflecting the whole point that these are private dependencies.

The test results here indicate how urgent it is that we fix our testing situation - this PR touches nothing that is tested, yet both main precommits flaked. I think the first prerequisite step is to make it easy and safe to change testing rapidly to experiment.

We are working on a private branch where we gather both Spark 1.x and 2.x in the same runner. The PR will be updated soon.

Here's the update with:
- rebased
- unique runner addressing both Spark 1.x and Spark 2.x
- profile to deal with dependencies

I'm doing the final touches and polishing.
@jkff @amitsela @aviemzur even if all the final polish has not been done, you can already take a look.

Oh nice! Can you elaborate on how the two profiles will work? Will we have continuous test coverage (unit tests and ValidatesRunner tests) both for Spark 1 and Spark 2? What should a user do to select which of the implementations is used in their pipeline?

Yeah, I will document a bit this in a `README`. Basically, the user can use `-Pspark2` to enable Spark 2. For the itests, it's the same: running with both `-Pvalidate-local-runner,spark2` will run with Spark2. The only small issue is that the profile is required: `-Pspark1` or `-Pspark2`.
That's the part I would like to polish and document.
I've been meaning to update this but haven't gotten back around to it yet.
R: @aviemzur
